block-definition.s: Get prediction from model %'name' with input %'input' $nl then %'process prediction' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to predict what the output should be for the 'input'. There is also a block for computing many predictions all at once.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Distance Compute Weighted Loss Cosine Distance Hinge Loss Huber Loss Log Loss Mean Squared Error Sigmoid Cross Entropy Softmax Cross Entropy

block-definition.s: Create and train color naming model $nl with layers %'layers' $nl with %'n' training steps

block.l: When this is finished training you can press the space bar to see the name of more random colors.

custom-block.s: Create a neural net model %txt %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with input size %s %br then %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing
Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

block.l: Training started. When finished the accuracy is the fraction it answered correctly in testing.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br unless no progress for %n cycles %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: Train the model. It will adjust neuron weights 'n' times to slowly reduce the error.

custom-block.s: Get prediction from model %txt with input %s %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
Categorical prediction sorted with confidence percentages %l

custom-block.comment: Asking the trained model to predict the color name for a new random color.

block-definition.comment: Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

block-definition.s: Categorical prediction sorted with confidence percentages %'prediction'
Open this in a new tab

Search and replace %'number of replacements' times $nl with number of experiments %'number of experiments' $nl with number of samples %'number of samples' $nl with %'number of training cycles' initial number of training cylces $nl do after each experiment finishes %'when an experiment finishes' $nl do after each replacement %'do with parameters' $nl then finally do %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt %br perform %n experiments %br where each experiment should run the same parameters %n times %br where at first run %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing %br Varying these parameters: %br optimization method %b %br loss function %b %br activation function %b %br shuffle data %b %br number of training iterations %b %br validation split %b %br dropout rate %b %br number of layers %b %br loss weight %n %br accuracy weight %n %br duration weight %n %br size weight %n %br variance weight %n

custom-block.l: Error while searching for good parameters

block-definition.s: process best parameters %'best parameters' %'number of replacements' %'number of experiments' %'number of samples' %'initial training cycles' %'when an experiment finishes' %'do with parameters' %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Replace model named %txt with the best model found %br and when finished %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

custom-block.l: Error while replacing model with best model while searching.

Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

block.l: Search finshed. Testing it with a new color.

custom-block.comment: Wil search for good model parameters several times and when it a better one is found replaces the model with that one and searches again.

block-definition.s: Replace model named %'model name' with the best model found $nl and when finished %'run after replacement' $nl but if there is an error %'run if there is an error'
block-definition.comment: This will replace the model named by the best model found by the 'Search for good neural net model ..." command.

block.var: run if there is an error

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl unless no progress for %'stop after' cycles $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. If three is no progress for 'stop after' cycles it will stop early. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' $nl perform %'number of experiments' experiments $nl where each experiment should run the same parameters %'number of samples' times $nl where at first run %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error' $nl Varying these parameters: $nl optimization method %'optimization method' $nl loss function %'loss function' $nl activation function %'activation function' $nl shuffle data %'shuffle data' $nl number of training iterations %'number of training iterations' $nl validation split %'validation split' $nl dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl number of layers %'number of layers' $nl loss weight %'loss weight' $nl accuracy weight %'accuracy weight' $nl duration weight %'duration weight' $nl size weight %'size weight' $nl variance weight %'standard deviation weight'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment. Each experiment will average the results of 'number of samples' runs with the same hyperparameters. After 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available. It scores each experiment by adding the weighted values of the loss, accuracy, time to train, number of parameter, and degree of variability in the outcome scores.
Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.
Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.

custom-block.s: Create and train color naming model %br with layers %l %br with %n training steps
custom-block.comment: This model is 100 neurons connected to 20 connect to 10 to n outputs where n is the number of unique color names. Experiment with other designs.

scripts.comment: This makes many mistakes - can you make it do a better job? Maybe more data would help.

custom-block.comment: You can train this with new (and more) colors by clicking this
Repeatedly name the color under the mouse pointer until the stop sign is clicked.
Opens up a page where you can create new models, train them, and use them for predictions. Also provides an interface for saving and loading models and training data. Try it!

custom-block.s: Open this in a new tab
Search for a good color naming model %br with layers %l %br with %n training steps
custom-block.comment: Will search for good parameters for the best accuracy. Can take a very long time.
